title: 105_s56
content: The "Dairy Promotion Equity Act" may be cited as the short title. It involves funding for the Dairy Promotion and Research Program. The Dairy Production Stabilization Act of 1983 is amended to include imported dairy products in its policy and definitions. The term 'imported dairy product' now encompasses various dairy items brought into the United States. The Dairy Production Stabilization Act of 1983 is amended to include imported dairy products in its policy and definitions. The term 'imported dairy product' now encompasses various dairy items brought into the United States, including milk, cream, butter, cheese, casein, and other dairy products. The funding section of the Act is also revised to adjust certain parameters. The Dairy Production Stabilization Act of 1983 is amended to include imported dairy products in its policy. The Board will now have 2 importer representatives appointed by the Secretary from importer nominations. The Dairy Production Stabilization Act of 1983 is amended to include imported dairy products in its policy. Importers of dairy products will pay an assessment to the Board, with the rate determined based on the value of the products. The Dairy Production Stabilization Act of 1983 is amended to include imported dairy products in its policy. Importers will pay an assessment based on the value of the products. A referendum can be requested by a representative group comprising 10% or more of producers to determine if the application of the Act should be suspended. Producers can request a suspension of the amendments made by the Dairy Promotion Equity Act until the results of a referendum are known. The Secretary will continue the suspension only if favored by a majority of producers engaged in milk production for commercial use.
